Package p4_group_8_repo.user

Class HighScores

java.lang.Object
p4_group_8_repo.user.HighScores
public class HighScores
extends Object
This class handles the listing of all high scores being stored within the game.
Author:
Liew Yih Seng

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  HighScores.HighScore
    A class that holds the detail of a single user that were to be added into the score_list.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(String name, int score, int level)
    A method that adds the HighScores() then sorts the score_list, arranging all elements within the list in a descending order based on the scores.
    static HighScores getInstance()
    Adhering the Singleton Design Pattern.
    ArrayList<HighScores.HighScore> getScoreList()
    A method that returns the score_list.
    boolean isNewHighScore​(int score)
    A method that tests if the score being input is higher than any of the scores inside score_list
    void newScore​(int score)
    A method that adds the score in to the score_list if the score to be added is tested to be a new high score by using method isNewHighScore(int) that returns a boolean stating the result of the test.
    void printScores()
    This method prints out the current high scores existed within the list.
    void writeScoreFile()
    A method that opens the scoreFile then writing the high scores into the file in order.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static HighScores getInstance()
      Adhering the Singleton Design Pattern.
      Returns:
      An instance of HighScores created.

    • isNewHighScore

      public boolean isNewHighScore​(int score)
      A method that tests if the score being input is higher than any of the scores inside score_list
      Parameters:
      score - An integer that represents the score achieved by the current user.
      Returns:
      A boolean that states if the input score is larger than any scores within the score_list

    • writeScoreFile

      public void writeScoreFile()
      A method that opens the scoreFile then writing the high scores into the file in order.

    • printScores

      public void printScores()
      This method prints out the current high scores existed within the list. The usage of this method is mostly for debugging as developers can check the current contents within the scoreFile.

    • getScoreList

      public ArrayList<HighScores.HighScore> getScoreList()
      A method that returns the score_list.
      Returns:
      An array list of HighScores.HighScore

    • add

      public void add​(String name, int score, int level)
      A method that adds the HighScores() then sorts the score_list, arranging all elements within the list in a descending order based on the scores. A for loop will be used to loop through all element within the list in order to perform the sorting of high scores.
      Parameters:
      name - A string that represents the name of the user.
      score - An integer that represents the score of the user.
      level - An integer that represents the level that the user has achieved.

    • newScore

      public void newScore​(int score)
      A method that adds the score in to the score_list if the score to be added is tested to be a new high score by using method isNewHighScore(int) that returns a boolean stating the result of the test.
      Parameters:
      score - An integer representing the score achieved by the user.
